Some 1.4bn dinars of Libyan money, worth £700m, was frozen by the British government when it was printed in the UK by banknote printers De La Rue, just as violence broke out in Libya.
Rebel forces have campaigned to be able to access that money as they have struggled to finance their uprising, but the UK government has always said it was legally unable to transfer the funds.
Now the government has decided that if a UN resolution can be passed it would allow it to transfer the money.
